channel.title: math.CV updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CV updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On The Relationship Between The Logarithmic Lower Order of Coefficients and The Growth of Solutions of Complex Linear Differential Equations in $\overline{\mathbb{C}}\setminus\{z_{0}\}$
item.dc:creator: Abdelkader Dahmani, Benharrat Bela\"idi

item.title: Extrapolating Solution Paths of Polynomial Homotopies towards Singularities with PHCpack and phcpy
item.description: arXiv:2403.14844v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: A robust path tracker [Telen, Van Barel, Verschelde, SISC 2020] computes the radius of convergence of Newton's method, estimates the distance to the nearest path, and then applies Pad\'e approximants to predict the next point on the path. Apriori step size control is less sensitive to finely tuned tolerances than aposteriori step size control, and is therefore robust. Extrapolation methods are effective to accurately locate the singular points at the end of solution paths, as illustrated with phcpy, the scripting interface to PHCpack.
item.dc:creator: Jan Verschelde, Kylash Viswanathan

item.title: Translation surfaces with large systoles
item.description: arXiv:2403.14923v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper we continue to investigate the systolic landscape of translation surfaces started in [CHMW]. We show that there is an infinite sequence of surfaces $(S_{g_k})_k$ of genus $g_k$, where $g_k \to \infty$ with large systoles. On the other hand we show that for hyperelliptic surfaces we can find a suitable homology basis, where a large number of loops that induce the basis are short.
item.dc:creator: Peter Buser, Eran Makover, Bjoern Muetzel
